intro: Gastrolychnis angustiflora, commonly known as the narrow-leaved candleplant, is a member of the Apiaceae family, characterized by its aromatic foliage and umbellate inflorescence. It is native to tropical regions of Africa and is known for its slender, lance-shaped leaves that are often aromatic. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in clusters, which attract various pollinators. Its root system is fibrous, and it is often cultivated for its ornamental value and medicinal properties. The plant thrives in moist, well-drained soils and prefers partial to full sunlight.
